hypothesis_content.title: USDT Liquidity Premium During Fiscal Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: During US budget crisis stress events, USD-pegged stablecoins (USDT) develop liquidity premium vs. non-USD pairs. BTC/USDT pair will show 1.5-3% premium over BTC/USDC and BTC/EUR pairs during stress peaks, reverting within 3 days post-event.
hypothesis_content.rationale: USD liquidity crunches create temporary demand surges for largest stablecoin (USDT) as offshore dollar proxy. This creates arbitrage opportunities against other currency pairs. Recent budget crisis provides testing ground.
entry_conditions: STRESS regime triggered by macro event (budget crisis, banking stress)
USDC/EUR trading volume ratio > 2:1 (indicating USD flight)
Funding rates negative across major USD pairs

exit_conditions.take_profit: USDT premium collapses to <0.3% OR 2.5% arbitrage profit captured
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Premium expands beyond 4% indicating potential depeg risk

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: No premium develops during stress, or premium persists beyond 5 days indicating structural change in stablecoin dynamics.
